Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the shoulder and neck section, with one handle surviving, of a red-brown pottery amphora, the fabric is relatively coarse and partially grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394480) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394480)
